alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Catawba; Cleveland; Davie; Gaston; Iredell; Lincoln; Mecklenburg; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 09 at 8:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of piedmont and western North Carolina, including the following areas, in piedmont North Carolina, Alexander, Cabarrus, Catawba, Cleveland, Davie, Gaston, Iredell, Lincoln, Mecklenburg, Rowan and Union NC. In western North Carolina, Burke Mountains, Caldwell Mountains, Eastern McDowell, Eastern Polk, Greater Burke, Greater Caldwell, Greater Rutherford, McDowell Mountains, Polk Mountains and Rutherford Mountains. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A low pressure system just west of the Appalachians will keep deep moisture in place across the area. Multiple rounds of slow moving showers and thunderstorms will continue through late tonight. This will result in the potential for flash flooding across the North Carolina foothills and Piedmont, mainly in urban areas and locations that have received heavy rainfall over the past few days. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Alexander; Catawba; Cleveland; Davie; Gaston; Iredell; Lincoln; Mecklenburg; Rowan
